name: Björn Waldegård
bio: The first-ever official World Rally Champion in 1979, Waldegård was known for his fearless pace and versatility across all terrains.

name: Walter Röhrl
bio: One of the greatest drivers in rally history, Röhrl combined raw speed with analytical precision, winning Monte Carlo in a variety of cars.

name: Hannu Mikkola
bio: A master of high-speed gravel rallies, especially in Finland and Kenya, Mikkola became a Ford and Audi legend across the decades.

name: Markku Alén
bio: Known for his aggressive style and passion, Alén was key to Fiat and Lancia’s success throughout the 1970s and 1980s.

name: Jean-Luc Thérier
bio: One of Alpine-Renault’s top talents, Thérier played a major role in securing Alpine's early WRC constructor titles.

name: Ove Andersson
bio: Founder of Toyota Team Europe and a skilled driver, Andersson was key to Toyota’s rise in rally racing later on.

name: Bernard Darniche
bio: Specialist of tarmac rallies, Darniche excelled at Monte Carlo and the Tour de Corse, piloting the powerful Lancia Stratos to glory.
